In this section, we will explore the command line interface (CLI). The command line provides a text-based way to interact with your computer, allowing for efficient file management and task execution. This introduction will cover the basics of navigation, file manipulation, and common commands.

## Syllabus

* Navigating the Command Line
* Learn how to move around the file system
* Exploring directory structures
* Absolute and relative paths
* Basic file operations
* Commands to inspect file content
* The Nano text editor for creating and editing files
* Creating and removing directories
* Searching within files
* Creating files
* Tab completion, command history, and searching
